structure

Class Location

  • java.lang.Object
    • structure.Location
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SpawnPoint

    public class Location
extends java.lang.Object
    Stores a Point with the coordinates (x,y) which will most often designate an object's location in the world. Has a variety of methods of modifying those coordinates as well as converting them to represent an object's location on screen and visa versa.
    Author:
    Spartak

      Modifier and Type Field and Description

    • Constructor Detail

      • Location

        public Location(double setX,
                double setY)
        Creates a location with the given coordinates. Meant to be used when creating a new Location at a specific point. When changing the location of an already existing point use the set coordinates function, or change(double, double)
        Parameters:
        setX - the new value of the horizontal coordinate
        setY - the new value of the vertical coordinate
        See Also:
        Location(), Location(Location), Location(Location, Camera)

      • Location

        public Location(Location location)
        Creates a new Location which copies the coordinates of the given location. This does NOT make this location reference the parameter,
        Parameters:
        location - the location whose coordinates will be copied
        See Also:
        Location(), Location(double, double), Location(Location, Camera)

      • Location

        public Location(Location locationOnScreen,
                Camera camera)
        Creates a location at the given point on the screen as seem by the given camera. The Location will be created as a "real" location and not an on-screen one.
        Parameters:
        locationOnScreen - the location whose coordinates will be converted to "real" coordinates
        camera - the camera that is viewing the location
        See Also:
        Location(), Location(double, double), Location(Location)

      • Location

        public Location()
        Creates a Location with the coordinates (0,0)
        See Also:
        Location(Location), Location(double, double), Location(Location, Camera)

    • Method Detail

      • changeX

        public void changeX(double xChange)
        Changes the x coordinate by the given value. Does what changeY(double) does for the the y coordinate
        Parameters:
        xChange - the net change of the x coordinate
        See Also:
        change(Location)

      • changeY

        public void changeY(double yChange)
        Changes the y coordinate by the given value. Does what changeX(double) does for the x coordinate
        Parameters:
        yChange - the net change of the y coordinate
        See Also:
        change(Location)

      • duplicate

        public void duplicate(Location location)
        Sets the coordinates of the location to match those of the given location. This is a "Hard" location set because the location will instantly change to match the parameter, for smoother change use change(double,double) or change(Location)
        Parameters:
        location - the location whose coordinates will be copied
        See Also:
        setCoords(double, double)

      • setCoords

        public void setCoords(double newX,
                      double newY)
        Sets the coordinates of this location to the ones passed in.This is a "Hard" location set because the location will instantly change to match the parameter, for smoother change use change(double, double) or change(Location)
        Parameters:
        newX - the new x coordinate
        newY - the new y coordinate

      • change

        public void change(Location locChange)
        Changes the coordinates of this location by the values stored in the location given as a parameter. This will not set this location equal no the paramater nor will it link their references.
        Parameters:
        locChange - the location by the coordinates of which this locations coordinates will be modified
        See Also:
        change(double, double)

      • change

        public void change(double changeInX,
                   double changeInY)
        Changes the coordinates of this location by the specified amounts
        Parameters:
        changeInX - the net amount by which the x coordinate will be changed
        changeInY - the net amount by which the y coordinate will be changed

      • getLocationOnScreen

        public Location getLocationOnScreen(Camera camera)
        Returns at what point on the screen this location will be as seen by the given camera
        Parameters:
        camera - the camera that will be viewing this location
        Returns:
        this location's coordinates on a screen stored in a new location

      • getLocationInWorld

        public static Location getLocationInWorld(Location locationOnScreen,
                                          Camera camera)

      • setFromScreen

        public void setFromScreen(Location locationOnScreen,
                          Camera camera)
        Sets the coordinates of this location to be what the coordinates of the passed location are in the "real" world. For example if a location on screen is passed in with the coordinates (x1,y1) then first of all based on the camera the passed in location's coordinates will be converted to their "real" values which are say (x2,y2) and then this location's coordinates will be set to (x2, y2)
        Parameters:
        locationOnScreen - the location on a screen whose "real" world coordinates will be assigned to this location
        camera - the camera that is viewing the passed location on screen
        See Also:
        #getLocationInWorld(), {@link #Location(Location, Camera)}

      • revert

        public void revert(Location previousChange)
        Changes the coordinates of the current location by the negatives of the coordinates of the passed in location. For example if the passed in locatioin has the coordinates (x1,y1) this function is equivalent of calling change(-x1,-y1)
        Parameters:
        previousChange - the location by the opposite of which this location is being changed
